info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 1 at 4:19PM MDT until June 1 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, southeastern Larimer.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 419 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Pennock Creek, Eld Creek, Redstone Creek, Sheep Creek, North Fork Fish Creek, Miller Fork, Cedar Creek, South Fork Cache La Poudre River and Buckhorn Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly rural areas of Southeastern Larimer County.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING
